characters: EXT./INT. ACCLAIM AT JIMMY'S GARAGE LOT- DAY
MODULAR AND MOBILE HOMES, NEW AND RECONDITIONED."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads "Bridge to Canada." A steep 1940's era customs bridge arches over the St. Lawrence River. Cars and trucks line up in different lanes. Customs officials inspect and question impatient drivers. Beyond them a smaller sign: "THANK YOU FOR VISITING MASSENA NEW YORK, IT WORKS, for business, for family, for you".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river stretches for miles in either direction, frozen, and still with trees on either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAY EDDY, 38, a bit worn for her years, with a long red ponytail, wearing an old bathrobe, sits in the passenger seat of her RED PLYMOUTH HORIZON with the door open, smoking a cigarette, thinking. Her breath is visible in the cold morning air. Her bare feet rest on the cold ground. Her 1970's rusted out TRAILER HOME SITS in front of her on CINDER BLOCKS AT A SLIGHT TILT. Beside it, a small SHED and behind it the CONCRETE FOUNDATION FOR A HOUSE. Around her, the yard is littered with junk: a rusted ski lift chair, the front end of a Plymouth Duster and a SMILING DUCK Kiddie Ride. Beyond the yard, flat, winterbare land. After a moment, a lanky boy of 15, her son, TROY, JR., leans out the trailer door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're out of Capt'n Crunch. His breath is visible in the cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give him toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got no butter, we got no jelly. Ray is out of ideas. He expects her to move, but she stays still. He looks around the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listening for the trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they really coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's dad? She is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (says it slow) Where's dad? She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how he found it, T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found what? Ray takes a drag off her cigarette. T.J. walks over to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I locked it in my glove compartment. T.J. looks in at the OPEN AND EMPTY GLOVE COMPARTMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I see that now, but the trucks were coming before the bank opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him you had it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh? No, I guess he just sniffed it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! The glove compartment!? That's the stupidest place you could have put it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't bought a scratch card in almost thirty two months. I thought it would be okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he leave anything? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could look for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could be anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should look for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rez,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With more than four thousand dollars, he's probably in Atlantic City by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's go, let's find him before he blows it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't do it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he'll lose it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J., we can't make him stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stole our money. Call the Troopers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not stealing if you take it from your family. Anyway, he made some of it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're just gonna sit there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. In the distance the RUMBLE OF TRUCKS. Ray hears it. It gets louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Christmas in the tin crapper. T.J. goes into the shed and slams the door. Ray throws down her cigarette and goes into the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around the cramped trailer at the oversized RENTAWORLD furniture including a big screen TV. An enlarged wall photograph of the family catches her eye. In it, her husband, TROY, SR., 40, wearing a forced smile, his long, shaggy hair combed flat for the picture. Ray hurries down the hall to her bedroom and takes off her bathrobe -- she has several tatoos -- and slides into a pair or jeans and a t-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleepy-eyed, toe-headed boy, RICKY, 5, walks in, shirtless in pajama bottoms, eyes shining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it here? Ray stops what she's doing when she sees him and kneels down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, little sleepy head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it here yet? `Cause I'm ready. He drags a suitcase full of plastic dinosaurs around the corner. The RUMBLE OUTSIDE GROWS LOUDER. Ricky BOLTS out of the bedroom and down the hall to the trailer door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a sec- He bursts into the yard where:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PICK-UP TRUCK DRAPED WITH A "WIDE LOAD" banner leads TWO SEMIS hauling halves of a DOUBLE WIDE MOBILE HOME wrapped in plastic, rippling in the wind. Ricky stops at the massive sight, twisting at his fly, trying not to pee himself. T.J. comes out of the shed. The Doubles come to a stop and idle in the yard. GUY VERSAILLES, pot-bellied, in a green velour running suit, squeezes out of his truck. On the door: "MASSENA

dialogues.speaker: MODULAR AND MOBILE HOMES, NEW AND RECONDITIONED."
dialogues.text: Ricky grabs a rope hanging off one of the doubles and tries to climb the side of it. The TRUCK DRIVER looks down from his cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ricky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down. Ray peeks out the kitchen curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment she comes out of the trailer, with a pasted-on smile. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all ready for ya'. She points to the new concrete foundation. He consults a clipboard. VERSAILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need the balloon payment to unload. T.J. looks at Ray. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have it, it's just that they called Troy from Titus last night. That's where Troy works. The ski place? And anyway- VERSAILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got the $4,372 dollars or not? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was some emergency with the lifts. So he took off without thinking with the money. Completely forgot you were coming. So as soon as he gets back- VERSAILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's he gonna be back? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as he can get here, I'll just run it down to you. T.J. could crawl out of his skin. VERSAILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironic smile) This is the second time you've dragged me out here. If you don't come up with it by Christmas, you've lost your fifteen hundred dollar deposit. He walks toward his car. She follows him. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mr. Versales, I have a good job at ALL FOR A DOLLAR. They're probably gonna make me a manager after Christmas so I can handle the payments if you just leave the house-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets in the car. VERSAILLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me when you have the balloon payment. He makes a circle in the air with his hand and the semi's rev their engines and grind into reverse. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you... Her voice is DROWNED OUT by REVVING engines. Ricky rushes to her. RICKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, where are they going? She takes his face in her hands. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. We'll get them back. RICKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why are they leaving? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky, I'll get them back. I promise, honey. RICKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our house! He BREAKS AWAY from her and RUNS down the road chasing after the semis. Ray chases after Ricky until he runs out of steam and stops, panting. She catches up to him and tries to hug him. He pushes her away. She gets down on her knees and takes his face in her hands. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna get it back. She picks him up and walks back to the trailer. Ricky looks out mournfully at the trailers disappearing down the road. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to T.J.) You better hurry or you're going to miss the bus. Let's get your clothes on, Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. just stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get a job you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're 15, T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't ask any questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're finishing school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you don't think we can live on what you make at All for a Dollar do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to school. She goes inside.   T.J. follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet I could make more than you do. She ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray helps Ricky into his clothes and puts his backpack on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's daddy? Ray and T.J. look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't we even gonna look for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'm going to work and you're going to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing that changed is that your dad started gambling again. Everything else is the same. RICKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he go? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to take a business trip. T.J. rolls his eyes. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you even gonna look for him? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And miss a day of work? No. Not again. We just have to live our lives. Now go get your backpack. T.J. stares, sullen. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on! RICKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When is daddy coming home? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Ricky. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're not even gonna look for him. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? Where do I look? (He can't answer) T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reservation. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, he could be in Atlantic City by now. She helps Ricky get his backpack on and gives him a kiss. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) The glove compartment. That's so stupid. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows Ricky out the door to catch the school bus rolling up out front. Suddenly, Ray remembers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait. They turn around. She digs in her pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Lunch money. They take it and keep running for the bus. Ray looks after them and reaches for her cigarettes. She takes out her second to last one. She lights it and takes out her mascara. She tries to put it on the bathroom mirror, but her tears keep getting in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAY stacks shelves with a knock-off version of plastic "My Little Pony" in a messy aisle of boxes. MATT, 22, her boss, bone thin with bad skin walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt. Could I talk to you? He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to come on full-time. Matt blinks with a blank expression then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you as a short timer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short timer. Not here for long, not really committed. Ray follows him to the stock room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I started you said it would be six months before I could come on full-time. And that was two years ago. He opens a can of RED BULL and takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I mean, you know, I do show up. Pat's late everyday. She's late now. She's always late. He stares blankly at her. She can think of nothing else to say. He walks out. Ray resumes unpacking ponies. A moment later PAT, 22, rushes in, looking sorry. As Pat hangs up her coat, Ray glimpses a tatoo just above her low riding pants with the words "How You Doin'?". Ray takes the last of her cigarettes out of the pack and heads out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya' tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray drives down a two-lane highway. It is empty flat land but for a few trailer homes and barns. She passes a lonely sign: "BRIDGE TO CANADA." Up ahead another sign: "AKWESASNE LAND OF THE MOHAWK." From the car, the Reservation consists of shabby houses with no siding, tax-free gas stations and dive bars with homemade signs. Ray slows a little to check out the parking lots scanning for her husband's car. Up ahead she sees a sign: "WOLF MART TAX FREE GAS AND CIGARETTES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls in to the combo gas station, restaurant and mini mart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOHAWK TEENAGER wearing a bandana RUNS out to the CAR without a coat, rubbing his hands together to ward off the cold. MOHAWK TEENAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill it up? She rolls down the window, digging for change under the seat of her car. She counts it out. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just three...uh, no...two seventy one, two, three, four. MOHAWK TEENAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two seventy four. He nods and goes to the pump. She finds a wadded up five dollar bill. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells out window) Make that seven seventy four. She spots a sign for "TRAILWAYS" bus in the window. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see a Blue Acclaim come in here last night? MOHAWK TEENAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Acclaim...no, but I only worked until 9 PM. You can ask inside. Ray glances inside at the mostly empty restaurant but for a few older Mohawk women. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's okay. MOHAWK TEENAGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want to support our Mosquito Lacrosse League. It teaches basic Lacrosse skills to the kids three to five. Ray shakes her head. MOHAWK TEENAGER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, anyway. Have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray continues down the highway through the reservation. She comes to a huge warehouse, the "MOHAWK BINGO PALACE." She glances over at the sea of cars surrounding it. At the end of a row she spots it: a BLUE ACCLAIM. Ray abruptly turns in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls up alongside the Acclaim and recognizes it by the "EASY DOES IT" bumper sticker. She gets out and looks inside. There is a small plastic T Rex on the floor of the backseat. She leans against the car for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Oh God, thank you, thank you thank you... After a moment Ray looks up at the Bingo Palace and heads for the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHORT, CHUBBY MOHAWK TICKET TAKER in her 60s, with piercing blue eyes and missing teeth sits perched on a metal chair beside a velvet rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunrise session is almost over. Next session starts at 10:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need to look inside. Ray starts to walks toward the door and the ticket taker sticks out her foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's $5 dollars for admission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to play, I just need to look around for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need the five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stand right here at the door. I won't even go inside. I just need to see if my husband's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still gotta pay admission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gambling away the money for our house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long brown hair. Tall. Skinny. Ponytail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I just look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, lady, he's not in there. Ray walks away. The ticket taker watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray walks out of the front entrance back across the parking lot toward the Horizon through rows of cars... Across the parking lot, LILA LITTLEWOLF, 20, a Mohawk girl with long black hair bursts out of the "Employees Entrance" and hurries across the parking lot pulling off her scratch card apron as she walks. Ray catches sight of her, but before Ray reaches the Horizon, Lila reaches the ACCLAIM, GETS IN IT AND BACKS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Lila drives off. Ray JUMPS back in the Horizon and TAKES OFF AFTER HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray follows the Acclaim down Route 37 and catches sight of it turning off on a dirt road. Ray makes the corner just in time to catch sight of the Acclaim bouncing off on a path through the woods. Ray follows it through the woods to a clearing: the Acclaim stops in front of a rusted out BUBBLE CAMPER. Lila gets out. Ray pulls up behind her and rolls down her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my car. Lila SPINS around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to the Acclaim)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing with my car? Lila fingers the keys in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That? I found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The keys were in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you just took it...? Lila goes in the bubble camper and shuts the door behind her. Ray gets out of the Horizon and walks up to the camper door and takes out her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll just see what the troopers say about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From inside camper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, they got no jurisdiction here. This is Mohawk territory. Ray stops dialing closes up her phone, then goes to her car and takes the gun and goes back to the camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knocks with the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can cut the bullshit and give me my keys now. There is no reponse. Ray waits for a moment and then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy, are you in there? There is no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're in there you better come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila sits on an army cot in the dingy camper next to a lamp on the floor. Her clothes are scattered among empty Pringles cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentative, controlled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy? Versales says as long as we get the money in by Christmas we won't lose the deposit. (pause) I think we need to talk about this, so come on out.(Pause) Troy? Troy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray aims the gun and FIRES into the camper door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shock of the blast throws Lila off the cot. She looks at the SMOKING HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding, honey, come on out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping behind the door for cover, Lila opens it. Ray looks inside: there is no sign of Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from behind the door) The Tribal police don't like people shooting holes in other people's houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is New York State so quit the bullshit and give me my damn keys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila throws the keys out the door. Ray picks them up off the ground. Lila shuts the door with her foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray gets in the Horizon and pulls it in behind the Acclaim then digs in the trunk, pulling out a rope. She ties one end to the Acclaim's back fender and the other to the Horizon's front fender. Lila watches out the camper window. Ray gets in the Acclaim and starts it up slowly TOWING the Horizon a few feet before the rope SNAPS. Ray gets out and looks at the broken rope. She begins digging in the trunk for more rope. Lila opens the camper door and looks at the bullet hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This camper belongs to my brother in law. He won't like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder) Then you should quit stealing cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was abandoned, the guy driving it got on a bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see where the bus was headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York or Buffalo, I'm not sure. Ray RE-TIES the tow line with the remaining rope. This time the Horizon goes an inch or two before the rope SNAPS. Ray gets out. RAY (under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Ray RIFLES through the trunk for more rope. "Home on the Range" plays on the cell phone in Ray's back pocket. Lila touches the bullet hole in the camper and listens to Ray's conversation from the doorway. Ray puts the phone back in her pocket and takes an old belt of her husbands and tries to attach the fenders of the cars. Ray gets back in the Acclaim and tries TOWING the Horizon once again. This time the right side of the front fender SNAPS OFF and droops to one side. Ray gets out and looks at Lila. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving this here. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at the Acclaim) I got a friend who might buy that. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not for sale. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll pay more than it's worth. Ray ignores her. LILA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe two thousand. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's always looking for cars with button- release trunks. Ray thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He don't need papers or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he use them to rob banks or something? Lila shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is he pays good for a car like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does he live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the woods. Not far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in it for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll give me something for finding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you try anything, I'm not afraid to use this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray drives with one hand and holds the gun with the other. It is pointed at Lila in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where that stump is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray makes the turn with one hand and the car bounces through an overgrown path in the woods. Ray reaches the stump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a path. Ray hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not far. Ray turns and drives into deeper woods. The gun jiggles around in Ray's hand as they bounce along between the trees. Lila tries to ignore it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car emerges from the woods at a BOAT RAMP leading to a mile-wide section of the FROZEN ST. LAWRENCE RIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks out at the ice. Tire tracks make a path across the snow-covered surface between carefully set out CUT EVERGREEN TREES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too fast. There's ruts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not crossing that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry they already put out the Christmas trees. There's no black ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's Mohawk land. The Rez is on both sides of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the border patrol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no border.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still not crossing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it'll hold a Plymouth. I've seen semis cross it. Ray looks at Lila suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only other way is the Cornwall bridge and they won't let you take that. (points at the gun). Suddenly, A TRUCK driven by a MOHAWK TEENAGER ROARS out of the woods and SWERVES around the Acclaim FISHTAILING then SPEEDING out across the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They plow it and everything. Cautiously, Ray lets off the brake and rolls down the boat ramp towards the smooth surface of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so fuckin' stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too fast, there are ruts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acclaim moves across the smooth surface of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray stares straight ahead clutching the wheel, barely breathing. Lila glances at the gun in Ray's hand, then out at the river, unfazed. They reach the midpoint of the river and pass it silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta pick up some speed to get up the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray speeds up. The Acclaim bounces up the steep bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just on the other side of those trees.

dialogues.speaker: EXT./INT. ACCLAIM AT JIMMY'S GARAGE LOT- DAY
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila pull into a used-car lot surrounded by a chain link fence. There is no sign of life. Ray stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honk the horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray honks. Suddenly, from under a gutted truck, A HUGE BLACK DOG, part wolf, SPRINGS onto the hood of the Acclaim. Ray is pinned against her seat at the sight of the dog. Lila GRABS the gun out of her hand and points it at Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray stares at the snarling dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep it shut. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray nods never taking her eyes off the dog. Lila honks the horn again and keeps the gun low and out of sight. Out of the garage comes JIMMY, 33, a stocky Mohawk, eating a sandwich. Jimmy looks suspiciously at Ray before he sees Lila. Thunder growls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder! SHUT UP!.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog GROWLS ferociously at Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back under there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder jumps off the hood and disappears back under the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy walks around to the passenger side of the car. Lila rolls down her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jimmy. Jimmy glances at Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He don't like whites, Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't even be dealing with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Sorry. He hands her a paper bag. Jimmy goes back to the garage and opens the door. TWO YOUNG CHINESE MEN in cheap jogging suits follow him out, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila hands the paper bag to Ray and points the gun at her, keeping it low and out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just count it. Ray opens the bag. It's full of cash. All fifties and hundreds. Ray counts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hundred. Lila opens the glove compartment and presses the trunk release. Jimmy motions to the Chinese men to get in the trunk. Jimmy shuts it. He taps twice on the hood of the car and walks back to the garage. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ray) Let's go. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, who the fuck are they? LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just back up. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not moving until those people get out of my trunk. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you half. Now let's go. Jimmy turns around, sees the two women arguing and gets suspicious. LILA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking them over the border. That's a crime. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no border here. This is free trade between nations. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a nation. Lila jams the gun into Ray's side. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Let's go. Jimmy starts back toward the car. Ray puts the car in REVERSE and backs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acclaim drives down the bank onto the frozen river and starts across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray drives. Lila sits angled toward Ray with the gun trained on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd your husband leave you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he wanted a younger women. Ray stares out at the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what usually happens. Ray says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never have to worry about that. My husband is dead. Went down in the river on a run. They never found him. Probably tangled in river weeds. She gives Ray a spooky look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better slow down there are ruts out here. You could get stuck in one. Ray speeds up and roars up the boat ramp off the ice skidding a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila bounce through the woods with Lila holding the gun, this time. They come to a dirt road then to an intersection with State Route 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray slows down at the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if the troopers stop us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't stop you. You're white. Ray keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just beyond the Reservation line, partly hidden behind a barn, a NEW YORK STATE TROOPER VEHICLE sits parked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls into a 1950s strip motel. A Pakistani man, the DEALER, looks out from the motel office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray sees the Dealer hurrying towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull around back then wait for him to come to the window. Lila keeps the gun low. The Dealer approaches cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll down your window. He walks up slowly and hands her a brown paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count it. Ray opens the bag and counts out the cash, as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila takes the cash from Ray and pops the trunk release. The two Chinese men hurry out. The Dealer ushers them into a Garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila return down Route 37 past the sign

dialogues.speaker: "AKWESASNE, LAND OF THE MOHAWK"
dialogues.text: Lila keeps the gun on Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks at the dirt road leading into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray hesitates. Lila jams the gun in her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't have my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't have my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila tries to push Ray out the driver's door with her feet. Ray clings to the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Suddenly, Ray grabs Lila by the hair and pulls her head down to the car seat. Lila hits Ray in the head with the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' bitch! Bleeding and holding Lila's hair, Ray pries the gun out of Lila's hand. Lila grabs the sack of money, jumps out of the passenger side of the car and takes off into the woods. Ray chases her, but Lila is faster and gets ahead, then disappears into the woods. Ray stops, panting, and wipes the blood from her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little bitch! Ray stares after her for a long moment then gets back in the Acclaim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray drives up in the Acclaim. T.J., wearing PROTECTIVE GOGGLES, works on the broken Duck Kiddie ride with a BLOW TORCH. He doesn't notice Ray. Ray covers over the cut with her hair and gets out and walks up behind him and taps him on the shoulder. He jumps and cuts the flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to use that thing when I'm not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I get it working I can sell it. She looks at the rusted pieces of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. Don't use that thing when I'm not here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rentaworld called. They're coming to get the TV if you don't pay by four tomorrow. He notices the car. T.J. (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find him? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was the car? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bus stop on the Rez. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he went to Atlantic City. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you could figure it out. Just find out what buses came through last- RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what? Chase him across the country. Miss work. No. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your face? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, did you get in a fight with somebody? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was no big deal. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got in a fight, for real? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some Indian chick tried to steal your Dad's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. I say we go back there and kick some Mohawk ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left it on the rez? That's so stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have a tow rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still say we go back there and kick some Mohawk ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it T.J. Did you and Ricky eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be kinda miraculous since there's no food in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popcorn and Tang. Ray goes towards the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila walks in off the road. MIKE, the owner, plays a handheld video game. She looks around the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Mohawk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Lila

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Mohawk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at a row of beat used cars. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's life at the Bingo Palace. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. How's business? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know, okay. She eyes a Malibu. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much for that one? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Lila. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! I've been saving up. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Bernie Littlewolf run your whole life? MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but he said not to sell you a car. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta walk down 37 with the semis kickin' up snow and mud in my hair just to get to the work. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, all I got are two Chevettes,a Horizon and a Civic. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like Chevettes. MIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured. She holds out a wad of cash. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a thousand for the Malibu. On the windshield of the Malibu in huge white letters: $750.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing with a trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing has been sittin' here for six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want Bernie in my face. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have to know. Mike rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray wakes up with Ricky staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, I was thinking. What's gonna happen to the tin crapper when we get our new house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half asleep)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna flatten it out and send it to China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna melt it down and make little toys out if it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll send them back here so I can sell them at All for a Dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can buy me some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray puts out a breakfast spread of Microwave popcorn and tang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not eatin' that again for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just have to make it to my paycheck on Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Rentacenter? She searches through the couch cushions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said they're coming to get the furniture if they don't get a payment by 4 o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me that already. She finds change and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, lunch money. She gives the rest to Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look I don't see why you won't just let me get a job with Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to T.J.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got like this whole business he runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sells pot to kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's computers. He works on computers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fifteen, it's not gonna happen so forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's so stupid. We're gonna lose the TV while I'm sitting in some Christmas assembly when I could be-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your job is looking after your brother. Who's gonna take care of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going out the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still say we should go back to the rez, get the Horizon and kick some serious butt. T.J. goes out the door behind Ricky and slams it in Ray's face. Ray slips into her jeans and goes to the bathroom mirror to put on her mascara. She cakes it on trying to ignore the cut over her eye but keeps looking at it. Finally she stops and stares at herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls up in front of the camper and stops. The Horizon is still there and all is quiet. Ray gets out holding the gun and a long rope goes to the bumper and begins to tie it to the other bumper, looking over her shoulder every once in while at the camper. Once she has tied the cars together she gets back into the Acclaim, but instead of driving off, she just sits there. After a moment, she gets out with the gun and walks up to the camper. The bullet hole in the door has a sock stuffed in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila is asleep next to a rattling propane heater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knocks with the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me! Lila's eyes pop open but she stays perfectly still. Ray shakes the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my part. Lila sits up on her cot and puts on her jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you the money if you give me the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I wanna get some more of those Chinese. The door opens. Ray steps back holding the gun. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna cost me to get that hole fixed. I froze last night. Ray holds up her hair revealing the cut over her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need enough for the balloon payment on my doublewide then I'm out of this. I'm no criminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people can call it what you want to. I just want my double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand staring at each other for a long moment, then Ray walks over and unties the rope around the bumpers of the Acclaim and the Horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't usually work with whites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. Ray gets in the driver's side of the Acclaim and starts it. After a moment, Lila gets in the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila drive across the smooth surface of the river. Ray smokes with one hand and holds the gun with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many bedrooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three. I got kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five and Fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a boy. Almost one. Ray looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lives with my mother-in-law. (after a moment) She stole him from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stole him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right out of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stole him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tribal police don't get involved in stuff like that. Lila looks out across the river at dusk with no expression. The ice looks clean and still. Ray picks up speed to climb the river bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila drive up in the Acclaim. Thunder SPRINGS out again, caught by his CHAIN just short of the car. Ray flinches but keeps hold of the gun. Jimmy walks out to meet them. Lila rolls down her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie was askin' if I'd seen you. I told him no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want any trouble with him, Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Jimmy's cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy's been calling all morning. He's got two up at the Old Casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Jimmy takes the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila rolls up the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta pick them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old casino through the woods. They used to have gambling there in the bootlegger days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila bounce through the woods to a collapsed building. An old BLACK SUV pulls up from the opposite direction, FACING THEM. Two MIDDLE-AGED CHINESE MEN, get out of the back. One carries an envelope. At the sight of Ray and Lila, he stops and says something to the other one. Both turn around and head back to the SUV. The DRIVER JACQUES BRUNO, a large Quebecois man, wearing a full-length fur coat gets out. They argue. He pulls out a LONG PISTOL and motions the men to the Acclaim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is he doing? Ray reaches for her gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep that thing down. Bruno walks towards the Acclaim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll down the window and see what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just roll it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruno stands at Ray's window. Ray slides the gun under her leg and rolls down the window. Bruno hands her a Tim Horton's bag. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quebec-French accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'ey don't like de women driver. He hands Ray the envelope of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count it. Ray nervously COUNTS the money as the Chinese men shiver outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hundred. Lila pops the trunk. Bruno and the Chinese men disappear around the back of the Acclaim. They hear the trunk SHUT. Bruno comes back to Ray's window and taps on it. Ray looks at Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it. Ray rolls down the window again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'is will keep d'em from running. He hands her men's shoes and dirty socks. Ray takes the belongings and ROLLS up the window and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray drives across the river. The socks and shoes are between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they want to run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get away from the snakeheads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snakeheads pay to get them here and then they gotta work off what they owe .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much does it cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty, fifty thousand. Depends where they're coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes they gotta work for years to pay it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get here? No fuckin' way. She gets a whiff of the socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God those are ripe. She throws them into the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They always stink. Two more cars are seen coming toward them on the river. They swerve wide to avoid the Acclaim. She speeds up to make it up the boat launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky watches cartoons on the big screen TV. T.J. flips through the telephone book to the back section: AKWESASNE and scans columns of names mostly either "BONAPARTE" "LITTLEWOLF" or "THREERIVERS". He chooses a name and dials the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Hello (in a grown-up voice) Is this Mrs. Irene ThreeRivers? -Mrs. Bonaparte, I have good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -I'm the business manager of Mr. E.F. ThreeRivers and I have been authorized to inform you that you have inherited money. -Are you still there? -Wait, I don't WANT any money, I want to GIVE you money. -That's right. You have inherited money from his computer fortune. -He was the second richest man next to Bill Gates. -He left you Twenty-six thousand seven hundred and fifty dollars.(pause)

dialogues.speaker: FIFTY DOLLARS
dialogues.text: -Oh no, you have no obligation whatsoever, Mrs. ThreeRivers, just a small processing fee of 29.00 dollars will authorize me to send out your first payment of thirteen-thousand three hundred and seventy five dollars. -You can put it on any major credit card. (pause) Of course, you can always refuse the money. -Sure, I can hold. T.J. holds his pen poised to write and looks at Ricky watching TV, then at the clock. It reads 3:40 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acclaim emerges from a dirt road onto State Route 37. Up ahead a sign reads: "YOU ARE NOW LEAVING AKWESASNE, LAND OF THE MOHAWK". The Acclaim drives past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in his New York State Trooper Vehicle, partly hidden behind a billboard, TROOPER MIKE NAPOLI, mid 40s, olive-skinned, watches the Acclaim drive by without expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray notices the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they always there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but they can't stop you unless you give them a reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever gotten caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gave me the choice of paying a fine or spending three months in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid the fine. I made the money back in two nights of smuggling. But back then it was cigarettes and everybody did it. Some of the troopers were into it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smuggling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But when they lowered the tax on cigarettes in Canada most people got out of it and the rest switched over to Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acclaim pulls around back. The Pakistani Dealer approaches the car and hands Ray a paper bag full of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray takes the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Count it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, be sure it's right. I don't wanna get stiffed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why don't you count it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got bad eyes. She counts it and nods at Lila. Lila POPS the trunk and the barefoot Chinese men get out. Ray and Lila look at them, they look back, blank and ungrateful. Ray rolls down the window and tosses out their shoes and socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. Ray swerves back out onto Route 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue down the road to the reservation line. After they pass the sign: YOU ARE ENTERING THE LAND OF THE MOHAWK, Ray pulls over and stops. Ray takes the money and consolidates it into one paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're even now. They stare at each other for a second or two, but Ray does not take out the gun. Lila reaches for the door handle Lila gets out. Ray drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen clock reads 3:55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RENTAWORLD truck is parked outside. Two large RENTAWORLD MEN sit in it. T.J. sees them from inside the trailer. He comes outside. He walks up to the trunk. One of the men rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom told me to give you her credit card number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only take cash or money orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, my Mom might be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got three minutes. T.J. goes back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky is glued to a cartoon. T.J. watches him, checking out the window every few seconds for Ray. A long moment passes with only the sounds from the cartoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RENTAWORLD men get out of the car and start toward the trailer. From down the road the Acclaim comes roaring along, kicking up dust. Ray swerves in and jumps out and runs up to the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I got it right here. (she waves a wad of fifties and twenties). Two fifty five, right? The men nod, relieved. Ray counts out the money. Ricky bursts out the door and runs towards Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches him in her arms and hugs him. T.J. stands at the trailer door, watching as the men drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ricky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to go the Price Chopper and get some Cap'n Crunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna to go to the Price Chopper? T.J. walks out, looking at the money suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt made me an assistant manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so hard to believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been like two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, and that's why he gave me a bonus. He isn't convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wanna go to the Price Chopper or not? T.J. gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the river, smoke curls from the chimney of a modest house. Lila perches in a tree nearby with a can of Pringles potato chips dropping every other one on the ground below where a huge WHITE DOG, part wolf, takes his share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the tree Lila looks inside the window of the house where: A baby boy, "LITTLE JAKE," about a year old, bangs his spoon on his high chair tray then throws it down. EVELYN LITTLEWOLF, 48, a tall thin Mohawk woman with long hair pulled back, picks it up and gives it back to him. He throws it again. She knows the game. She gives it back, but the third time she holds it just out of his reach and laughs at him. He bangs his fists on the tray. Lila drinks in the sight. Abruptly, the DOOR OPENS and EVELYN leans out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chance! Chance, get in here before you freeze your ass off. The White Dog looks up at Lila who shakes the Pringles can upside down to show it's empty. Chance goes inside. The door SHUTS behind him. Lila stuffs a wad of cash in the can and jumps down from the tree. She leaves it near the front door and hurries into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray tucks Ricky into the bottom bunk. The wind whines in the loose siding. Ray stuffs a blanket around the window to block the draft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray walks through the kitchen now full of groceries and opens a can of Adirondack Cola. The remains of two Hungry Man dinners sit on the table. She sits down in the living room. T.J. watches the local weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEATHER MAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Temps will dip tonight and tomorrow. Expect a Clipper from Northern Ontario to bring 8 to 12 inches of snow and winds gusting 25-45 miles an hour making it feel like minus 30. Area farmers are advised to bring in livestock. More on this after a message. A blaring TV commercial for the "HOT WHEELS TECH TRAX AIR STUNT CHALLENGE SET" comes on. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he wants. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He points at the TV. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christmas. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, again? T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recites it quick) Hot Wheels Tech Trax Air Stunt Challenge Set. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Hot Wheels Tech Trax, what? T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air-Stunt-Challenge-Set. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got something even better than that. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The double wide. But don't mention it to Ricky, just in case. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, "just in case." RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time is for real.

dialogues.speaker: T.J.
dialogues.text: Is that why you bought Calgon Bath Stuff?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Yes it is. We're getting a tub, T.J. It's gonna happen. T.J. Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: If you keep that attitude I'll never let you use it. T.J. Be afraid. Be very afraid. (a moment) What about Dad?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: What about him? T.J. What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Why, did he call broke yet? T.J. No, but maybe he would call if you weren't so bitter.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Oh, here we go again with Saint Dad. T.J. That's what I mean. You're always on him. "Where's your paycheck, do you need a meeting, give me your receipts."

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: He's an addict, T.J. T.J. You're still bitter.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: You gotta help Ricky get the tree up tomorrow after school okay? T.J. Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Christmas shopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray lays down her bed and checks her cell phone for new messages: a little zero blinks at her. She listens to her own cell phone message,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, it's me. leave a message, and maybe I'll call ya back. It is harsh. She erases it and tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fake cheerful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi....it's me...leave a message and I'll call ya' back. She plays it back. It sounds fake. She tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (less cheerful, forced)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, leave me a message and I'll call ya' back. (under her breath) You son of a bitch. She plays it back. "You son of a..." was recorded. She tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, it's me. I can't take the call right now, but if it's you, Troy, please at least tell me you are alive, because the boys are worried about you. She brings up OLD MESSAGES on her cell phone and listens to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I just got done here. I made two hours overtime fixing one of the snow- making machines. Pretty cool, huh? I'll be home late. I'm gonna catch that meeting at 7:30. Love you, bye. Ray stares across the room at a pile of Troy's dirty flannel shirts. She gets up and picks up the pile to move it to the closet, but feels something hard. From a shirt pocket she pulls out a stack of used scratch cards. She throws the shirts in the closet and reaches for her cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out a glossy picture of her double wide dream home, "The Commodore" a gleaming pre-fab structure with a landscaped yard and a family with paid-for smiles. After a moment she takes the wad of cash out of her pocket and begins making stacks of fifties and twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camper is buried in snow. A shiny SUV pulls up out front. BERNIE LITTLEWOLF, 35, burly, well-dressed, Mohawk man gets out. He yells across the yard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila. Get up. I got a job for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila is sound asleep on her cot under three blankets next to the propane heater. Bernie's snow balls THUMP against the side of the camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila! Get up. Lila opens her eyes and looks out the window, squinting at the snow glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got two people out sick today, so if you get down there you got the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get dressed, I got coffee. Let's go! He holds up a paper cup. She slips on her jeans with a sweatshirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila forces the door open against the heavy snow and steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in, I'll tell you on the way. She grabs her coat and trudges across the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie hands her a paper cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita said you quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fired me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what she said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she should have. I can't see to count the money. I told you that. I come up short half the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get some glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make me carsick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a break. She sips the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tribal Council needs someone to answer phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! She reaches for the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? You can answer a phone, can't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not there! Not with them. She starts to get out. He notices the Horizon, buried under the snow, near the camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some white lady. He says nothing. Taps his thumbs on the steering wheel, suspicious. A long moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need a car for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get to work. So I don't have to walk in the breakdown lane. Last week I almost got hit by the plow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll live. And you know what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't have a trunk. He stares at straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right! I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray rings up a counter full of merchandise for a heavyset CUSTOMER in her 20s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The customer hands her a credit card. Ray processes the credit card. It is declined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Didn't go through. The customer looks up with exaggerated annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a low voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can try to put it though again. The customer grabs her purse from the basket, and walks out the door, leaving the merchandise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells back at Ray)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem with your machine, lady! Ray moves the merchandise aside for the next customer. It is Trooper Napoli. Ray is startled to see him. He puts down some shaving cream and a diet Pepsi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rings him up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be three seventy six. He digs in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got exact. He counts it out. She hands him his bag and watches him walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mohawk paintings and a huge wolf carved out of wood decorate the waiting area. Nearby is an office marked "GRAND CHIEF" A MOHAWK WOMAN walks by the desk and recognizes Lila, then looks away, quickly. A tall, middle-aged woman, GRAND CHIEF ROSALIE comes out of the office and walks up to Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have any messages? Lila hands her a stack. She takes them and walks away, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't read this. She holds the message out to Lila. Lila tries to read it, squinting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's a "T.".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't read any of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Bernie I couldn't see. Lila grabs her jean jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevermind. I'll go. She walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls up in heavy snow. Lila gets in with a gallon of windshield wiper fluid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get extra fluid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get back before KMART closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got nothing for under the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray fills the car with gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila goes inside to get some Pringles. Looking into the small restaurant she sees Evelyn Littlewolf, her mother - in-law and Little Jake sitting at a table with Grand Chief Rosalie. She stops dead in her tracks at the sight. They do not see her. Slowly, she walks up to the table. Little Jake notices her first. ANGLE: Through the window Ray catches sight of Lila standing at the table perfectly still. The other women glance up at her then turn away. No one speaks. Lila walks off with Little Jake still watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila drive across the smooth river surface. Snow falls steadily. The windshield wipers SNAP back and forth. They barely avoid the oncoming headlights of another smuggler's car crossing the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you people even take Christmas Eve off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mohawks don't celebrate Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could fool me the way they were all lined up at All for a Dollar today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are Christians. The converted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the Longhouse ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's awful not to have Santa Claus-- for the kids, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. dumps the contents of a box containing the pieces of an artificial Christmas tree. Branches cover the floor. The boys begin putting it together like a puzzle. The TV is on. A commercial for the HOT WHEELS TECH TRACK AIR STUNT CHALLENGE SET comes on. Ricky trains in on it, flinching and jerking his body with sound effects at the sight of the flying Hot Wheels cars and the booming voice of the announcer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy is gettin' me that for Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Santa Claus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's bringing the new house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila drive up. Jimmy runs out with his jacket pulled over his head. He sees Lila and signals to the garage. Two figures start toward the car. As they get closer, Ray sees a man and a woman. Both Pakistani.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. They're not Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're "Pakis."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're from Pakistan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. What difference does it make? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big difference. The Pakistani couple stand outside the car, shivering and holding out the cash. The man carries a heavy duffle bag. Ray rolls down the car window. The man holds out money to Ray but she doesn't take it. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we wait much longer we won't be able to get back across the river. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not driving just anybody across the border. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want the money or not? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna know what's in the bag. Ray looks out the car window and points to the bag speaking loudly. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in there? The man looks at the woman. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't understand you. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if they want to come over here so bad, they ought'a take the time to learn English. Lila pops open the trunk. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold on a second. Ray gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pakistani woman crawls into the trunk and the man picks up the duffle bag to put it in but Ray takes hold of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that. Ray motions him into the trunk and shuts it. Then she opens the bag and starts to rifle through it but Lila stops her. Lila

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Just count the money and let's go. Ray looks down at the bag. Nothing is visible but clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we keeps snowing like this we won't be able to get across the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hope these aren't the ones that blow up themselves and everybody with them. Ray zips the bag up and Lila helps her slide it in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila get back in the car. Ray starts to count the money. Lila takes it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acclaim creeps along in heavy snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila struggles to count the money by the light of the glove compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a two or a five?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances down) A five. Ray creeps along straining to see out the windshield. The windshield fluid peters out. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Lila looks up. Outside is a wall of white. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta stop so I can fill up the wiper fluid. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stoppin'. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hundred feet deep out here if we get on black ice Ray sticks her head out the window but the snow and the wind are too strong. She stops. Lila gets out with the wiper fluid. Ray pops the hood. Ray looks in the backseat at the duffel bag. She hesitates a moment then reaches into the back and opens the back passenger door and slides the bag out of the car. Lila gets back inside. LILA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuclear power, poison gas,...you can't tell what they might have in there. I'm not gonna be responsible for that. Ray tries the windshield wipers. Fluid clears the windshield. Ray dials her cell phone with one hand. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Hi, I'm gonna be a little late.(pause) -I have to work. Is Ricky asleep? -Put him on. (pause) -Ricky listen to me, he's not coming until you go to sleep. (pause) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -No. Not yet. He's still flyin' over Canada okay? He's not even done with Canada yet, so he's not coming until you get to sleep. Now put your brother on. -I'll be home in a little while, okay? -No, I haven't got it,yet. What's it called again? -Hot Wheels Tech Trax Air Stunt whatever, right, right, I'll get it if I can! -I can't promise T.J. -There are more important things to get for Christmas this year. Be home in a little while. Okay, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lila)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think a new house would be enough. Ray guns it up the boat launch to the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the living room, the artificial Christmas tree is up. The TV is on and Ricky is untangling a ball of red Christmas lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dials the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Hi, is Mitch there? (a long pause) The microwave dings. Holding the phone, T.J. takes out two Hungry Man dinners and sets them on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Hi Mitch. It's T.J. No, T.J. from school. Yeah, man. Right. Uh, I was wondering if you still needed those numbers we were talking about `cause I got one. -How much? -Cool, but the thing is I don't really have any wheels at the moment. -On Moira road off 37. -Yeah, but there's one more thing...(he whispers into the phone inaudibly)...no the air stunt challenge set. -Yeah, exactly. Yeah, man. Thanks a lot. Bye. He hangs up and puts the dinners on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ricky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky, time to eat. T.J. turns around. Ricky has wrapped himself in Christmas lights from head to toe, by slowly revolving while holding the strings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
