dialogues.text: Hey T.J., watch this! He plugs in the lights and they turn on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's pretty cool. But it's gonna hurt when you sit down. Ricky giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now unwrap yourself, it's dinner time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila drive to the back of Bob's. The Dealer hurries out to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Ray a wad of cash. She counts it, then nods to Lila who pops the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pakistani man and woman hurry out of the trunk, looking around, and rush to the passenger door of the Acclaim, speaking frantically to each other. The Dealer tries to hustle them to the garage, but they won't be moved. Ray starts to back out, but the Dealer knocks on their window. Ray rolls it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say there's a bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was too heavy. We had to unload it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dealer tells the woman in Urdu. She becomes HYSTERICAL. She grabs Ray through the window and the dealer pulls her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with her!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had something in the bag. The woman continues screaming in Urdu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is she saying!? He speaks to her in Urdu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says her baby. Her baby was in the bag. The Dealer and the man hurry the wailing Pakistani woman into the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila and Ray pull back onto Route 37 and drive along in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't feel like there was anything in that bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe they put their baby in a duffle bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you left it out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd let me search it I would never have taken it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray speeds along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partly hidden, behind a barn, Trooper Mike Napoli watches the cars pass on Route 37, leaving the Reservation. The Acclaim passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trailer is aglow in Christmas lights. Ricky has fallen asleep on the couch. A car horn blows outside. T.J. runs outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat up car is there. Inside a teenager, MITCH, a few years older than T.J., hands him out a Hot Wheels Tech Track Air Stunt Challenge Set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you wanted, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close enough. T.J. gives Mitch a piece of paper with a list of names and credit card numbers including that of Irene ThreeRivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Man, Have a Merry One. T.J turns to go back inside. He sees SMOKE RISING through the cracks in the siding and goes to the back. BLACK SMOKE POURS from under the trailer where old insulation is smoldering. T.J. runs to the shed, takes a fire extinguisher and sprays under the trailer. Steam rises. The fire appears to be out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. comes back in. Smoke filters up though the cracks in the linoleum floor. He covers Ricky with extra blankets and opens the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila drive down the boat launch to the river. The storm has stopped and the river is an endless white surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila creep along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there. Tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squints)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there. Ray speeds up. Faint tire tracks appear in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down, I don't want to run over it. Stop. I think it was here. Ray stops the car. Lila gets out. Ray puts her jacket over her head and follows. Ray's cell phone plays "Old MacDonald" on the seat of the Acclaim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing his coat in the trailer, with the windows and door open, T.J. dials the phone. He gets Ray's cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faintly heard though the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, it's me. I can't take the call right now, but if it's you, Troy, please at least tell me you're alive, because the boys are worried about you. He doesn't leave a message. Ricky snores on the couch covered in a pile of blankets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila runs ahead. Ray struggles to keep Lila in sight. Ray comes up behind Lila, rifling through THE UNZIPPED DUFFEL BAG. She suddenly jumps back at the sight of the tiny face of an infant, wrapped in blankets, eyes closed, lips blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead. Ray looks at the baby. Instinctively, she swoops down and gathers it up. Ray heads for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Lila follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray gets in the car and sets the bundle down on the seat, unwraps it from layers of swaddling and begins taking off it's clothes. It is a boy. She tries to resuscitate him, but there is no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead. Ray keeps giving it air. There is no response but she keeps at it. Then, between breaths:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tap the bottom of his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they did to get Ricky breathing when he was born. Ray puts the baby on Lila's lap. She pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't hold it and drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray cranks the heater and aims the vents at the baby. Lila stares down at the baby in her lap, not touching it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least put him next to your body. That will warm him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it! We can't give it back to her cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. closes the windows and puts a package of microwave popcorn in the microwave and turns it on. He watches it begin to smoke, then pops open the microwave and takes the smoking bag from room to room to hide the smell of burnt insulation with burnt popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls out onto Route 37 and passes the reservation line: "You are now leaving the land of the Mohawk" Trooper Napoli watches the Acclaim pass again. This time he pulls out behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray notices the cruiser following her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Lila looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. Lila quickly pulls the baby near and wraps him inside her coat hiding him from sight. The DOME LIGHTS START FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down. Just pull over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he saw us go by before. To Bob's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got no reason to stop us, unless you give him one, so keep your mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he searches the car. What do we say about-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't, just remember you're white. Ray pushes the blankets onto the floor and kicks them under the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls into the breakdown lane and the trooper pulls in behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Ray's rear view mirror, Trooper Napoli gets out of the cruiser. He puts on his hat and walks toward the car. Ray rolls down her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: License and registration? Ray hands them over. He examines them, then leans down to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you step out of the vehicle, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fakely nice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't speeding, was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just step out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I do something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am I'm just directing you to step out of the vehicle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. She gets out of the car reluctantly. He looks in at Lila, she keeps her head down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step around to the back of the vehicle. He follows Ray to the back of the Acclaim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at the trunk. Ray stares at it, afraid to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that. Ray stares at the back of the car, afraid to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your left rear parking light is not illuminated. Ray notices the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't know. He takes out his pad and pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna give you a provisional citation. Get this repaired in the next 48 hours and you'll have no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he looks into the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks after my kids when I have to work late. Ray gets back in the car. He shuts the door behind her and gives Lila a friendly nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have an enjoyable Holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you, too. She rolls up her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her rear view, Ray watches him get in his vehicle, u- turn and drive out of sight in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a blown out tail light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. looks at the clock. It's after midnight. He leads Ricky, half asleep into his room and tucks him in bed. Then he takes out the Hot Wheels Box and puts it under the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila pull in to the motel but there is no sign of life. Ray gathers up the blankets. Lila sits motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta take it in. Lila sits absolutely still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Are you sure? Lila slowly takes the baby from inside her jacket.   His eyes open. He blinks. Ray and Lila stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello little baby. The baby looks back at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just cold. Ray and Lila wrap him up in the blankets and get out with Lila carrying the bundle and walk into the motel office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila look around the shabby motel office circa 1950s with a few threadbare chairs. No one is at the front desk. Ray ventures behind the desk and knocks on a small door. She carefully opens it to a small office with a desk, cluttered with papers and, beyond it, another door. Ray knocks and opens it to: A living room hung with heavy red Pakistani fabrics and lights. The dealer and the Pakistani man study a map of New York State spread out on the table. Behind them the Pakistani woman sits on the couch. Ray comes in, followed by Lila carrying the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found him. The Pakistani woman looks up, sees the bundle and hurries across the room to Lila. Lila holds out the baby with a little smile and the Pakistani woman snatches it out of her arms. The Pakistani women pulls back the blanket and sees the baby -- alive. She sinks to her knees letting out a wail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila's eyes fill with tears. Ray chokes back her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lila)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Let's go. Lila follows Ray out, looking over her shoulder at the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila and Ray drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, whatever, you brought him back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the Great Spirit, not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is Kmart is closed and I got nothing for under the tree. Lila looks at Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Lila says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't have time for that. I can't get deep about every little thing. I just have to keep on going. I only need one more run to have enough for my double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila pull up in front of Lila's camper and stop. Ray divides the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Lila takes the money and starts to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas or whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Lila gets out and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray drives up. The trailer is covered in Christmas lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray comes in. The box containing the Hot Wheels Tech Track Air Stunt Challenge set is under the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot Wheels. She is suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch? Is that the friend you called? It's probably stolen, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, its not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't want you hanging around him. That kid is bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like you were gonna get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look , Mister, I got more important things to worry about than toys. I'm trying to get our doublewide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you can lose the attitude. Anyway, Kmart was closed by the time I got off work. He gives her a sideways glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to be careful with the microwave, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy THUD as something hits the side of Lila's camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie! She opens the door, but no one is there. At her feet she sees a Pringles can. In it: the cash she left at her mother-in-law's house for her son. She looks towards the woods but there is no sign of anyone. She shuts the door. Inside she digs through an old box of junk and pulls out a 2 foot long oval shaped wooden board, an infant board, and a blanket. She wraps her pillow in the blanket around the board in the Mohawk tradition and picks it up. She tries it on her back, then leans it against the wall, then hangs it on a hook on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas Morning. Ray stands at the stove in her bathrobe making pancakes. T.J. helps Ricky set up his new Hot Wheels Set. A Knock at the door. Another knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy? Ricky runs to the door and opens it, then backs away. Trooper Napoli is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a Ray Eddy here? Ray comes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I speak to you outside for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't gotten the light fixed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about that. I just have a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray slips on her boots, grabs her jacket around her and steps outside the trailer door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is about the woman who was with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you known her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too long. She looks after my kids. TROOPER NAPOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a smuggler. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? TROOPER NAPOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That's a shock. TROOPER NAPOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, there is that element on the Reservation I'm sure you know. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've heard about it but I didn't know she was involved. TROOPER NAPOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you happen to meet her? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I think there was a sign for a baby sitter at the Wolf Mart. That's where I get my gas. TROOPER NAPOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought you should be aware of that. She's known to have smuggled illegal immigrants into the country. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. He nods his head. TROOPER NAPOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were you I'd find a new baby sitter. You don't want her around young kids. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. He eyes the side of the trailer where smoke stained siding is visible. TROOPER NAPOLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you have an enjoyable Holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. You, too. Ray stands and watches the trooper drive away. She feels in the pocket of her bathrobe for her cigarettes and fumbles to light one, sucking on it, unaware of the cold. When she turns around she looks at the trailer and notices the smoke-stained siding on one end of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. listens at the door. Ricky looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is the police man here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. From outside the door:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. could you come out here for a minute. T.J. goes outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray stands staring at T.J. at the trailer's burnt end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he want? Did something happen to Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what did he want? She points to the blackened siding on the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have a fire last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pipes froze so I fixed `um.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fixed um?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you happen to use the blow torch? She walks around back and looks underneath the trailer: a mass of charred and melted insulation. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. We can't live here anymore! T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a tin crapper. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was our house. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we're gettin' a new one, right? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you could have killed yourself and your brother. She grabs the blowtorch and slams it to the ground, but it is indestructible. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not yours, he gave it to me. She goes to the car, takes out her gun then puts the blow torch on the ground and aims at it -- but T.J. grabs it. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna shoot me now, too? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that thing down! He ignites the blow torch to spite her. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he didn't like gettin' shot in his own house. Maybe that's why he left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was an accident. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some accident you shot him in the foot. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spent the food money on scratch cards, T.J. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, he'd done it before. He aims it at her. She walks towards him. He increases the flame. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that thing. She tries to grab it out of his hand, but he is too strong. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. come on now. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't have it. It's mine. His eyes fill with tears, but his face stays tight. She grabs at it again, but he jerks it away. She pauses and stares at him. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was clean for 23 months. They look at one another. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chokes back tears) I didn't know how else to keep us together. I mean...he's a good dad when he's not gamblin'. He cuts off the blow torch. T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, awesome dad. Robs us and takes off a week before Christmas. She walks up to him and wipes a tear from the side of his face. He shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand in the cold air for a long moment their breath visible. She touches his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray drives up in the Acclaim. Lila and the Horizon are gone. Ray gets out and looks around but there is no sign of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray slowly cruises the lot looking for the Horizon. She spots it in the distance behind the Bingo palace next to a dumpster. Ray parks and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The short chubby toothless Mohawk ticket taker perched on a metal stool beside a velvet rope. Ray sees her and begins to dig in her jeans for a five. The ticket taker looks her up and down, expressionless. Ray hands over the money. The ticket taker just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game's over. They're verifying the last winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. I still wanna buy a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sell you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to buy some scratch cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to Wolf Mart, they sell `um there. Ray walks away. The ticket taker watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray slumps down in the driver's seat of the Acclaim waiting for Lila to come out. She is parked a few cars away from the Horizon. Other bingo players come out and get in cars surrounding Ray. Mohawks employees, including Lila come out of the "Employees Entrance". She starts toward Horizon. She wears new glasses. Catching sight of Ray in the Acclaim, she abruptly turns and starts walking in the opposite direction. Ray pulls out and drives over following her in the Acclaim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quit smuggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls down the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. set the trailer on fire. Lila keeps walking. Ray drives along beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't mean to, but the pipes froze and he got that damn torch out -- which I told him not to do touch when I wasn't there -- and he tried to thaw them out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got glasses and now I can see up close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hole in my bedroom floor. We gotta move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila keeps walking. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need one more run to get the double. Lila keeps walking. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look you can have the Acclaim. Okay? Lila keeps walking. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it then?! Lila keeps walking. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still mad about that baby? `Cause it wasn't all my fault, ya' know. I mean who puts their kid in a duffle bag? Lila keeps walking. Ray follows trying to figure her out. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna need a lot of money to take care of a one year old baby. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got enough. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you gotta get him first. Lila stops dead in her tracks and looks at Ray. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you. You can even borrow my gun. Lila looks around to see if anyone is watching and gets in the Acclaim with Ray. ANGLE FROM BINGO PALACE ENTRANCE: The Ticket Taker watches the Acclaim drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila pull up outside the model double wide home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many bedrooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three. And it's got a jacuzzi tub in the master bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wall to wall carpet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. But the best thing is the insulation. The pipes can never freeze. Ray gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back. She disappears into the Office. Lila looks at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray comes in on Guy Versailles giving a young couple the hard sell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what I think you'll find with the Commodore -- and you'll be the judge -- is that the vinyl wall covering is perfect for small children. There is never a need to repaint or even touch up-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna schedule a delivery. Versailles looks up, annoyed. He plasters on a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the couple)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me just a second. He tries to take Ray aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? She pulls a huge wad of cash from her jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this all of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's three thousand but I want it delivered tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you all or nothing. She holds out the cash. The couple tries not to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it as a deposit. All you have to do is show up. If I don't have the rest you keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't argue with that. You'll have to sign something, though. He takes out a contract and writes in the deposit amount as thirteen hundred seventy two dollars owing. Ray signs the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray drives down the boat launch and starts across. The sky is clear and the moon shines down on the white river surface. Downstream patches of the river have thawed and water flows is visible. There is only the sound of the wheels on the smooth ice surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's is dark. Ray and Lila sit a minute. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow the horn. Ray honks the horn. A light comes on. Jimmy runs outside in a t-shirt. Lila rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heat wave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a run for us, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty slow after Christmas. Unless you wanna to go off the Rez, there's a guy up in Montreal who's usually got heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty miles or so. But...you gotta watch out for the Mounties and the Surete. and...this guy deals in ya' know girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila drive down a Quebec highway. The road signs are in French. The skyline of Montreal is an orange glow in the far distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few times. Have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Troy didn't like to travel. He liked to work in his shed, mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila drive down a commercial strip of shopping centers, fast food joints and strip clubs, with French names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't miss that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray pulls in at a giant neon silhouette of a naked woman. They drive around back and get out. THROBBING DISCO music is heard from inside a door marked "Prive."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in. The place is mostly empty. There is a scantily dressed BARTENDER and JACQUES BRUNO sitting at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruno. She points to Bruno. Lila and Ray approach him. He is on his cell phone speaking in French. He looks them over, then closes up his telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking for a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jimmy called-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, Jimmy. Okay. He calls over the Bartender. She comes over. He points to Ray and Lila. She walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila put up their hands. The Bartender pat frisks them for body wires. When she is finished:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up his full-length fur coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'is way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow him out the back of the club. The Bartender follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'at your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the Acclaim parked a few feet away. They nod. He walks out to a shed and unlocks the door. Two very young CHINESE GIRLS, sickly and pale, wearing jean jackets look vacantly out. Bruno signals them to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get paid, first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a wad of cash from inside his coat and hands it to Lila. She counts it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only got six hundred here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the rest at drop off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's six hundred apiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls stand shivering by the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUNO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the deal I make with Jimmy, now you want to change? Lila and Ray look at each other. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's twelve hundred. BRUNO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to make a problem? Bruno glances at the Bartender watching from the back door of the club. BRUNO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed by Ray) ...because you're not making a problem for me. And you're making a problem for them. Let me show you something. He approaches the two girls. He grabs one of the girls by the hair, kicks her in the back of the knees forcing her to the ground. Lila looks at Ray. The girl tries to get on her feet, but each time she does he kicks her in the back of the knees again. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ray) Let's just go. Held up by her hair, the girl slides around helplessly. Lila winces at the sight. Ray stares at Bruno. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We'll take them. Lila looks at Ray. Bruno drops the girl who scrambles to her feet. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just open the trunk. Lila leans into the passenger side of the Acclaim and pops the trunk. Bruno looks at Ray:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRUNO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be the brains of the operation. He motions the girls into the trunk and shuts it after them. Lila get in the passenger side and Bruno starts for the back door of the club. Ray pulls her gun out of her jacket and aims it at Bruno. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around! Bruno stops and turns around. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the rest. He opens his fur coat. BRUNO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool) I don't have any more. In the shiny coat lining only the handle of a long pistol is visible. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Bartender) Go get it. Bruno looks around and nods at the bartender. The bartender panics not knowing what to do and begins speaking in French to Bruno. Ray shoots at the pavement beside Bruno. BRUNO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Give it to her. The Bartender disappears into the club. Ray waits with the gun on Bruno. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from inside the Acclaim) Let's get out of here. I'll give you the rest of the money. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna get us all killed. A moment later the Bartender comes back, shaking and holding cash. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it there. She indicates the trunk. BRUNO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) You aren't so smart as you look. Ray grabs the money and still pointing at Bruno, backs into the car. Bruno reaches for his pistol and aims at them as the Acclaim squeals away. Bruno FIRES shattering the driver's side window, grazing Ray's head. Ray falls back, dazed for a moment. Lila steers. Then Ray takes the wheel as they swerve out onto the main road. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shot me. Ray wipes the blood from her forehead. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should'a just taken the money from me? RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blood streams down her face) I'm tired of people stealing from me.    Is it all there? LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get outta here, first. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just COUNT IT and make sure it's all there! Ray hands her the wad of money. Lila struggles to put on her glasses and counts out the money. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down a little. We gotta keep it under the speed limit. Ray smiles and wipes away the blood. They drive a short distance. Ray checks the rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get off this road. Lila looks in the rear view. Headlights appear behing them. Ray speeds up approaching an intersection: the sign reads

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. Lila looks back in the rear view mirror. The headlights are gaining on them. She SPEEDS through it. A local SURETE DE QUEBEC police cruiser parked out of sight TAKES OFF after her, LIGHTS FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get off this road!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray swerves off the main road to a DIRT ROAD. The Qubec police follow. Ray swerves off the road and across a field into the WOODS and kills the HEADLIGHTS. The Quebec Cruiser CHASES them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray speeds down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much farther to the reservation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just up at the tree line. Ray speeds towards it, but the Quebec cruiser still pursues them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? We're on the reservation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't arrest us but if they catch us they'll take the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Ray bounces into the woods through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acclaim emerges from the woods at the edge of the river. The International Seaway Bridge looms above the ice surface of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them the flashing lights close in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ice is black out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it hold us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Ray looks at her for a moment then drives toward the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, the Quebec cruiser BRAKES at the edge of the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Qubec officer GETS OUT TO WATCH the Acclaim drive out across the ice. He radios to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BORDER GUARD picks up the phone. He nods, then hangs up and makes a call to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trooper Napoli hears the call on the police radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the Quebec Surete in pursuit of a vehicle with New York State plates, identified as a blue Plymouth Acclaim and the suspects are two women, suspected to be carrying illegals... He recognizes the car and u-turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Lila hold their breath as they cross the river. They make it over the midpoint and Ray accelerates toward the shore. Two hundred feet from the bank, the BACK RIGHT TIRE HITS A CRACK in the ice. The TIRE DROPS and the UNDER BELLY of the car SCRAPES THE ICE. SPARKS FLY. The RIGHT REAR END of the car DROPS DOWN and the FRONT LEFT TIRE LIFTS off the ice. The car TEETERS BACK AND FORTH. Ray and Lila sit perfectly still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta crawl out the window. Lila rolls down her window. The car shifts. The wad of cash SLIDES toward the edge of the dashboard. Ray grabs it. Lila pops the trunk. The two Chinese girls scramble out. The four begin RUNNING FOR THE SHORE.

dialogues.speaker: THE UNDER THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Trooper Napoli watches the action on the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAR SINKS DEEPER INTO THE WATER on one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, Lila and the Chinese girls keep running, slipping and sliding, falling. Lila and Ray stop and go back to help one of the Chinese girls who keeps falling. When they get to the shore, they climb up the bank and collapse on the snow, gasping. ANGLE: Trooper Napoli gets in his cruiser and heads down the bank toward the women, lights flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two headlights are seen in the distance coming toward them. A PICKUP TRUCK approaches along the shore. Jimmy drives it. He gets out, gathers Ray, Lila and the two Chinese girls into the back of the truck and drives away. Ray looks back as the Acclaim SLIPS THROUGH THE ICE AND DISAPPEARS. Trooper Napoli reaches the scene, too late. No one is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small house on the river's edge with a hand painted sign:"Bakery" Jimmy drives up. He helps Ray, Lila and the Chinese girls to the door. The Ticket Taker, "VELMA" opens the door, wearing an apron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, I told you not to bring no more half frozen people in here off the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just need to borrow your oven, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads them, wet and freezing, to the bakery kitchen. As they go by Velma and Ray recognize each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An industrial oven sits beside an old couch. Lila, Ray and the teenage girls stand near it shivering. Velma looks them over, frowning and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how I can get any baking done. I'm supposed to be baking 200 doughnuts for pee wee Lacrosse and now I have people bleeding and dripping all over my kitchen. She opens a closet filled with Indian medicine plants and takes out several kinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ray)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, I can't reach up that high. Ray sits down. Velma reaches up and dabs Ray's grazed and bleeding forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ray)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like somebody tried to blow your brains out. Ray winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here, Jimmy. They gotta strip down. (to girls) Gimme those jackets. Velma motions to the Chinese girls to take off their coats. They stare at her shivering. She gently goes to one of the girls and helps her out of her jean jacket. Under it she wears a short sleeved shirt showing her bruised arms. Velma sees the bruises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's been beatin' up on you. Lila and Ray see the girl's black and blue arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Velma hangs the girl's jacket on the big oven to dry and gives her an old blanket to keep warm. Then Velma turns to Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOHAWK CHIEF OF POLICE, BILLY THREE RIVERS, a stressed- looking man in his 40's talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Good, good Mike. What can I do for you? - -You say non-native smugglers? -A white woman? On the Rez? -I'll look into it and give you a call back. Sure thing. (pause) -I'll take your request to the Tribal Council and give you a call back. -No problem, Mike. You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy Three Rivers sits down at a long conference table. A middle-aged Mohawk woman, "BARBARA" sits behind a name plate reading "CHIEF". At the end of the table Bernie sits behind another name plate: "SUB-CHIEF." Rosalie comes in wearing her coat over her bathrobe and takes her place behind the "GRAND CHIEF" name plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Rosalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts on her glasses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a situation with a couple smugglers. They got chased by the Quebec police and crossed the river but their car went in and now the troopers know they're on the Rez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE RIVERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila Littlewolf and some white woman. ROSALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do the troopers want? THREE RIVERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surrender of the two illegals and the Non-Native smuggler. They need an example here. ROSALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where they are? THREE RIVERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably over at Velma's. ROSALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the other Chiefs) What do you think? BARBARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn them in. ROSALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Lila Littlewolf? BERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got our own court system. ROSALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't charge people with smuggling. BARBARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should. BERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we did, we'd have to arrest half the people on the Rez. Rosalie and Barbara shoot him an ANGRY STARE. He shrugs. BARBARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can expel her. BERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't start throwin' Mohawks off the Rez, Rosalie. There's only, what, six thousand of us as it is. ROSALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes the Mohawk people look bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she has a Mohawk son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cost us a Mohawk son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake was a big boy. He knew what he was doin'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll never be anything but a smuggler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had smuggling on the Rez since Al Capone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll take a vote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two New York State Cruisers block the road, lights flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell on the bakery door RINGS. Billy Three Rivers walks in looking very official. Jimmy opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Billy. He comes in and Velma walks in from the kitchen closing the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Velma, seen any smugglers tonight? Velma says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Billy, you never bothered with smugglers before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalie is worried people are gonna think the Mohawks let in terrorists. Plus, I got the Troopers on my back. They want the illegals and they say there's some white lady with them too. Is that true, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got white women doing it now? Jesus. (after a moment) Well, if you see any, let me know. Three Rivers leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila and Ray LISTEN from the kitchen. Ray eyes the back door. Ray grabs her jacket off the oven and takes half the cash out of the pocket and hands it to Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Lila takes the money. The Chinese girls look on confused. One gets up and grabs her jacket, but Ray motions her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You stay here. Ray hurries to the back door, opens it, but Bernie Littlewolf is there. At the sight of him, Ray backs up. He walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a lot of trouble. Lila looks at him, unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The council voted to expel you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expel me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For five years. You can appeal, but you'll never be able to change Rosalie's mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't do that. BERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll make your life miserable if you try to stay. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've already done that. BERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, it could get even worse. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was all legal on the reservation. Bernie ignores her. RAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lila) Look, I gotta get home. She moves for the door, but Bernie blocks her. BERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she leaves, they'll turn you in Lila. The troopers want somebody. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, she's a Mohawk. BERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chiefs want her out, so there's nothing standing between her and the troopers. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, my kids got no one but me. BERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you leave she won't see her son again. Ray and Bernie stare at each other. LILA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go. BERNIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila, you're giving up on him and he's only one year old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ray)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go. Ray goes to the door, but turns around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you got family to take care of him, ya' know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray shuts the door behind her and starts toward the river. She turns and runs along the bank...a long way...then slows down. Breathing hard, she stops. Snow melts on her face. A long moment passes. The sound of the river ice pushing against the bank releases a long, deep moan all around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila and Bernie sit on the old sofa by the big oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might be better off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake wouldn't agree with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was all for a new crib. I wanted the baby to have a pretty new crib, not some handmedown. And he wouldn't let me go alone. (laughs) I was too fat to get behind the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted to keep you and little Jake safe. The back door opens. Ray is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a few months, right? Bernie and Lila turn around. Ray walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got baby stuff in the shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes the folded double-wide contract out of her pocket and holds it out to Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a good used single wide with insulation. Insulation is the key thing. Versailles will give you a hard time, but that will leave enough for you and the boys to live on for a couple of months. Ricky's allergic to penicillin.(a moment) And you can't feed `em Pringles all the time. Okay? Lila isn't sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Lila nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you gotta get there quick, before the police, `cause T.J. will get scared. I don't want him to get scared, you know. Ray chokes back her own tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Lila takes the contract from Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't let him jerk you around. Versailles, I mean. (to Bernie) Go with her. Okay? Bernie nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. and Ricky eat supper to the glow of the TV in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have more corn? T.J. dumps his own corn onto Ricky's plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing dome lights of New York State troopers are seen just beyond the sign "YOU ARE NOW LEAVING THE LAND OF THE MOHAWK." Trooper Napoli waits in his cruiser with other vehicles. Billy drives Ray and the Chinese girls slowly toward them in the Mohawk Tribal Police Cruiser. Billy stops and the three get out of the car, handcuffed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie waits in the car. Lila walks to the front door. Thunder looks up from beside the front step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shows her empty hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Thunder, I got nothing for you. She knocks. Evelyn opens the door. Seeing Lila she tries to close it, but Lila WEDGES herself inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evelyn tires to push her out, but Lila walks in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? Lila walks up to the Little Jake sitting in his high chair, his face covered in carrots. She reaches out to touch him, but Evelyn pushes her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need his coat. Lila picks up the baby, and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's his coat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't have him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs Lila's arm, but Lila shakes her arm free and wraps Little Jake in her own jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say goodbye to your Dudah. Evelyn stands in front of the door, blocking Lila. Lila stops and they stand for a moment looking at each other. There is anger and sadness. Evelyn moves aside. Lila walks out with the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie stands by the car holding a CAR SEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna kill me for taking this out of her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray sits in the backseat. The two Chinese girls beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long is it for me. You know if I confess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as they're not on a watch list. Four months. He glances around at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you have much to worry about judging from the look of them, probably brought here to work in the sex trade. Ray looks at the two girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will they get sent back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily. They can apply for asylum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a cigarette? He lights one for her. She takes it, shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there somebody I can call for you? To take care of your children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got somebody. He looks back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A relative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend. Trooper Napoli looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I need to call my kid.

dialogues.speaker: INT RAY'S TRAILER
dialogues.text: The phone rings. T.J. picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Hi, Mom. She hears his voice and can't speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Mom are you there? What's wrong? -What kinda trouble? -What did you do? -A smuggler!? Holy shit! -Are you in jail? -But are you're going to jail!? There is a long silence. He wipes a tear away with his sleeve. Ricky plays with his Hot Wheels on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Yeah, okay. What does that mean? But why? I can take care of him, I do it all the time. But I don't see why we need-?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Who? (pause) A baby? No way. -Yeah I know where the stuff is. It's in the shed, but that's so stupid!. A KNOCK at the door. T.J. looks at it, unsure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Yeah, I'm here. Somebody's at the door. He walks to it and opens it holding the phone. Lila is standing there holding Little Jake, wrapped in her jean jacket. T.J. and Lila look at each other.   She walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Okay. Bye. He hangs up. Little Jake sees Ricky playing with the Hot Wheels Set and reaches to get down. Lila puts him on the floor. He crawls toward the Christmas tree and the Hot Wheels set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ricky )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to get the little pieces up high -- or he'll eat them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray rides in the back of the Cruiser. They pass by trailer homes decorated for Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Semi ROARS down the road with "WIDE LOAD" banner hauling a single wide mobile home through the bright morning light, plastic covering rippling in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the blow torch, T.J. works on the smiling duck Kiddie ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky plays with Little Jake, dressed in a snow suit. Lila comes outside with a plate of peanut butter sandwiches, badly made. T.J. signals Ricky who brings Little Jake over and puts him on the Kiddie ride. Ricky holds him on the seat and T.J. flips a switch. The ride JERKS a few times then starts to move back and fourth. Little Jake smiles. Behind T.J. a Mohawk Tribal Police Cruiser drives up. Billy Two Rivers gets out and walks up to T.J. He speaks sternly to T.J., pointing at the cruiser where an elderly and frail Mohawk women in her eighties, Mrs. ThreeRivers, looks out the window. T.J. walks over to the cruiser. She rolls down the window. He says something to her, looking at the ground as he speaks. Ricky and Lila holding Little Jake look on. Billy Two Rivers drives away. SUDDENLY T.J. and Ricky LOOK UP. A RUMBLE is heard in the distance. From down the road the SEMI is seen APPROACHING... T.J. smiles and Ricky watches not sure whether to believe it or not. He takes T.J.'s hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is asleep in her new bedroom with wall-to-wall carpet and a big window. Her cell phone RINGS. She doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her voice message plays)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, (happy) You've reached Ray. Leave me a message and I'll get back to you just as soon as I can. The tone is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sad sack voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, are you gonna pick up or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I need you to send me some money so I can get home. I'm stuck here. I could already be back at work by now.(pause) Please Ray, I'm at the YMCA in Tampa. I love you. I miss you. Please call me here. Seriously. And tell the boys-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message cuts off with a "BEEP." ClOSE ON: the cell phone screen. "12 NEW MESSAGES" changes to "13 NEW MESSAGES."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads "Bridge to Canada." A steep 1940's era customs bridge arches over the St. Lawrence River. Cars and trucks line up in different lanes. Customs officials man booths at the center of the bridge, inspecting and questioning impatient drivers. Beyond them, a smaller sign: "THANK YOU FOR VISITING MASSENA NEW YORK, IT WORKS, for business, for family, for you".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river stretches miles in either direction, no longer frozen and still with trees on either side.
